column34: Please let us know where you heard about us?

column10: Walking from a path that leads to/from stoplight crossing on Columbia Pike and Lincolnia drive and to the sidewalk on Maplewood Drive, there is a blind curve at the intersection of Maplewood and the Columbia Pike service road. Because there is no signage, crosswalk (signaled or non signaled), drivers on service road can't see pedestrians crossing Maplewood. Pedestrians can't see cars turning. I was crossing with a friend and we almost got hit by a car coming from service road. As we are both over 65 we don't move particularly quickly. I had to grab my friend's arm to yank him out of the way of the car.
column21: There is no sidewalk on the side of Maplewood that is closest to the Columbia Pike/Lincolnia intersection. there is also a bus stop there so pedestrians coming from Maplewood either have to cross in front of the blind curve or walk unprotected and with traffic and not against traffic (their back is to traffic) and there are cars parked on that side of the street so they are additionally vulnerable
